cutter.tools

Class ConsoleExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • cutter.tools.ConsoleExecutor

  • public class ConsoleExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class makes it possible to execute console commands and read the output
    Author:
    Phil Niehus

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConsoleExecutor(boolean resetOutputHistoryBeforeExecution) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disableAutomaticHistoryReset()
      Disables the reset of the output history before the execution of a command
      void enableAutomaticHistoryReset()
      Enables the reset of the output history before the execution of a command
      void execute(java.lang.String command)
      This method executes the given command and saves the console output WARNING: If you want to add some parameters to your command, call the execute method like this: execute(new String[]{"command", "parameter", "parameter"});
      void execute(java.lang.String[] command)
      This method executes the given command with the given parameters and saves the console output Keep in mind, that even a comma is a new parameter for example: execute(new String[]{"WMIC", "PROCESS", "get", "Commandline", ",", "Processid"})
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getConsoleOutput()
      This method returns the console output since the last reset of the console history
      void resetOutputHistory()
      This method clears the output history

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleExecutor

        public ConsoleExecutor(boolean resetOutputHistoryBeforeExecution)
        Parameters:
        resetOutputHistoryBeforeExecution - this Boolean defines wether the history is cleared before the execution of a command or not

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String[] command)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method executes the given command with the given parameters and saves the console output Keep in mind, that even a comma is a new parameter for example: execute(new String[]{"WMIC", "PROCESS", "get", "Commandline", ",", "Processid"})
        Parameters:
        command - the Command and parameters the command will be executed with (each parameter as a new index)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String command)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method executes the given command and saves the console output WARNING: If you want to add some parameters to your command, call the execute method like this: execute(new String[]{"command", "parameter", "parameter"});
        Parameters:
        command - the command that will be executed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • resetOutputHistory

        public void resetOutputHistory()
        This method clears the output history

      • enableAutomaticHistoryReset

        public void enableAutomaticHistoryReset()
        Enables the reset of the output history before the execution of a command

      • disableAutomaticHistoryReset

        public void disableAutomaticHistoryReset()
        Disables the reset of the output history before the execution of a command

      • getConsoleOutput

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getConsoleOutput()
        This method returns the console output since the last reset of the console history
        Returns:
        the output history since the last reset as List
